New Records: Dawid Malan scored a career-best 140 in ODIs, surpassing his highest Test score
Joe Root contributed 82 off 68 and surpassed Graham Gooch to become England's all-time highest scorer at World Cups
Reece Topley took four wickets for 43
Key Match Events: Dawid Malan's 140 helped England bounce back with a World Cup win against Bangladesh
Reece Topley took four wickets, including those of Tanzid Hasan, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Shakib Al Hasan, and Mushfiqur Rahim
Mark Wood bowled with venom and sustained pace, conceding 29 from his 10 overs and splattering the stumps of Shoriful Islam
Chris Woakes's efforts with the new ball were again expensive, and eight overs into Bangladesh's innings he had bowled four, taken no wickets and cost 34 runs
Post-Match Reflections: Malan's century was a rarity in this format, in that his second 50 was considerably slower than his second
He smashed five boundaries off his next nine deliveries including four in a row off Mehidy Hasan Miraz
His 140 is his highest ODI score, and the same as his highest Test score
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was affected by a violent storm that shook Dharamsala on the eve of the match
England's new dawn was partially obscured by a couple of dark clouds, including Chris Woakes's expensive efforts with the new ball and the middle order's feeble performance
Others: England won the match by 137 runs
Bangladesh's only real ambition was damage management after Topley's initial success
